results.title: A Perfect world
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Mark Johnson and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: Eight year old Phillip, the son of a devout Jehovah’s witness mother, is staying home while all other children are out trick-or-treating. The next morning their home is broken into by prison escapee Butch Haynes, who needing a hostage to aid his escape from jail, grabs Phillip and flees. Phillip curiously looks up to Butch and willingly accompanies him as they take to Texas highway on the run from the cops. Butch is not particularly anxious to make it to the Texas border, being more concerned about fulfilling Phillip’s prohibited wants and dreams. Texas Ranger Red Garnett is not in any hurry to catch Butch either. As Butch and Phillip form a father-son relationship, the paths of Butch and Garnett gradually come together in time for a final confrontation. Cast includes Kevin Costner, Clint Eastwood, Laura Dern and T.J. Lowther.

results.title: A Peep into a well known pottery works
results.brief_description: A stack of clay, flint and stone are taken to the Mill house to be ground. Then to the strip house for weighing of the ingredients, sieving, and plugging the clay. Often the clay is passed to the potters for throwing and turning. The product is then dried and placed into an oven. This is followed by painting and glazing. Other items are passed to the gilders where only the best gold is used, and then to the burnishing shop. A museum contains many specimens up to the present day.

results.title: A pattern of scientific discovery
results.brief_description: “Summary: takes as a case study the discovery of a whole group of new substances known at various stages in their history as the inert gases, the rare gases and the noble gases. traces the discovery from the work of Henry Cavendish through the theories of William Prout, to the discoveries of baron Rayleigh and William Ramsay. it is pointed out how improved communication between scientists helped in these discoveries and the importance of technology in the form of the spectroscope and apparatus for liquefying air, and concludes that the interdependence of science and technology is a familiar aspect of much scientific discovery”

results.title: A Pathological anxiety
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson Associates and Robert Anderson
results.brief_description: A presentation of psychoneurotic conditions. Examines the effect of mental disorder on behaviour, using as an illustration the case history of an office worker whose efforts to suppress his hostility result in a sense of terror and panic which prevents him from leading a normal life. Filmed at Montreal General Hospital with Dr A. H. Marcus and Dr Nathan B. Epstein.

results.title: A Passage to India
results.creator_credit: EMI/Parlophone, Home Box Office, John Brabourne, Richard Goodwin and David Lean
results.brief_description: A passage to a land of spell binding mystery, of painful paradox and magnificent splendours. The enigma which is India enticed a young Englishwoman, drew her with an attraction which became an obsession - an obsession which caused an echo which would reverberate through the whole sub-continent. What happened that day in the Caves of Marabar would change her life - and haunt India forever. Based on the novel by E. M. Forster. This recent production stars Judy Davis, Peggy Ashcroft, Alec Guinness, Victor Bannerjee, James Fox and Nigel Havers.

results.title: A Park for all seasons
results.brief_description: Mossvale Park, nestled between Leongatha and Mirboo North in South Gippsland, is host to all types of community events from family barbeques to music festivals. Matt Dennis tells us why he is drawn to this “natural and beautiful place”.

results.title: A Park community
results.brief_description: The park is a natural ecosystem within the city. Plants are the producers, using energy from the sun to produce food by photosynthesis. Animals are the consumers; mushrooms are decomposers. man contributes by mowing the grass and pruning the trees and shrubs to substitute for grazing and browsing animals that are not there, he also fertilizes to supplement natural decay, and waters to supplement natural rainfall. These inter-relationships are examined and a pattern of observation for exploring a local park is thus provided.

results.title: A Pair of One
results.brief_description: Greta and Freda Chaplin are English identical twins who dress alike, try to walk in step and, for much of the time, speak the same words in unison. They are inextricably bound to each other and, if separated, they wail and scream. There are many twins who dress alike and behave somewhat alike, but the Chaplin twins are described as being amongst the most uncanny. Estranged from their mother and sharing a house with a sympathetic man who read of their strange case in a newspaper, the twins live a curious, fragile and somewhat fearful existence. Their story sparkles with the crazy quirkiness of the far edges of humanity, yet it resonates with the essence of every human. It is impossible not to be fascinated by this film.

results.title: A Pair of moccasins for Mary Thomas
results.creator_credit: B T Filmsound, National Indian Arts and Crafts and Geoff Voyce
results.brief_description: We follow Mary Thomas, a Sioux Interior Salish Indian, as she makes a pair of moccasins, the most common Indian footwear and a part of Indian cultural heritage. Starting from the treating of animal hide, Mary uses traditional methods, right through to the finished product.

results.title: A Painting for people
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Noel Price
results.brief_description: Harold Freedman was employed by the Victorian Government to paint a large mural for the Spencer Street Railway Station on the one hundred years of transport, 1835-1935. Depicts the research, hundreds of drawings and the scope of work required to complete the first part of the mural. Narrated by Harold Freedman. Suitable for secondary school level.
